verses.verse: And Abram <S%H87><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, he <S%H802><s%>, and his wife, and all that he had <S%H3876><s%>, and Lot with him <S%H5045><s%>, into the south.
And Abram <S%H87><s%> was very <S%H3966><s%> rich <S%H3513><s%> in cattle <S%H4735><s%>, in silver <S%H3701><s%>, and in gold <S%H2091><s%>.

And he went <S%H3212><s%> on his journeys <S%H4550><s%> from the south <S%H5045><s%> even to Beth <S%H1008><s%>–el, unto the place <S%H4725><s%> where his tent <S%H168><s%> had been <S%H1961><s%> at the beginning <S%H8462><s%>, between Beth <S%H1008><s%>–el and Hai <S%H5857><s%>;

Unto the place <S%H4725><s%> of the altar <S%H4196><s%>, which he had made <S%H6213><s%> there at the first <S%H7223><s%>: and there Abram <S%H87><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> on the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
And Lot <S%H3876><s%> also <S%H1980><s%>, which went with <S%H854><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%>, had flocks <S%H6629><s%>, and herds <S%H1241><s%>, and tents <S%H168><s%>.

And the land <S%H776><s%> was not able to carry <S%H5375><s%> them <S%H3427><s%>, that they might live together <S%H3162><s%>: for their substance <S%H7399><s%> was great <S%H7227><s%>, so that they could <S%H3201><s%> not live <S%H3427><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>.

And there was strife <S%H7379><s%> between the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Abram <S%H87><s%>'s cattle <S%H4735><s%> and the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Lot <S%H3876><s%>'s cattle <S%H4735><s%>: and the Canaanite <S%H3669><s%> and the Perizzite <S%H6522><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> then in the land <S%H776><s%>.

And Abram <S%H87><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Lot <S%H3876><s%>, Let there be <S%H1961><s%> no <S%H408><s%> strife <S%H4808><s%>, I pray you <S%H7462><s%>, between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen <S%H7462><s%>; for we <S%H582><s%> are brothers <S%H251><s%>.

Is not the whole land <S%H776><s%> before you <S%H6440><s%>? Separate yourself <S%H6504><s%>, I ask you <S%H8040><s%>, from me: if you will take the left hand, then I will go to the right <S%H3231><s%>; or if you depart to the right hand <S%H3225><s%>, then I will go to the left <S%H8041><s%>.

And Lot <S%H3876><s%> lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> all the plain <S%H3603><s%> of Jordan <S%H3383><s%>, that it was well watered <S%H4945><s%> every where <S%H6440><s%>, before the Lord <S%H3068><s%> destroyed <S%H7843><s%> Sodom <S%H5467><s%> and Gomorrah <S%H6017><s%>, even as the garden <S%H1588><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, like the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, as you come <S%H935><s%> unto Zoar <S%H6820><s%>.

Then Lot <S%H3876><s%> chose <S%H977><s%> him all the plain <S%H3603><s%> of Jordan <S%H3383><s%>; and Lot <S%H3876><s%> journeyed <S%H5265><s%> east <S%H6924><s%>: and they separated themselves <S%H6504><s%> the one <S%H376><s%> from the other <S%H251><s%>.

Abram <S%H87><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%>, and Lot <S%H3876><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the cities <S%H5892><s%> of the plain <S%H3603><s%>, and pitched his tent <S%H167><s%> toward <S%H5704><s%> Sodom <S%H5467><s%>.
But the men <S%H582><s%> of Sodom <S%H5467><s%> were wicked <S%H7451><s%> and sinners <S%H2400><s%> before the Lord <S%H3068><s%> exceedingly <S%H3966><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Abram <S%H87><s%>, after <S%H310><s%> that Lot <S%H3876><s%> was separated <S%H6504><s%> from him <S%H5375><s%>, Lift up now your eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and look <S%H7200><s%> from the place <S%H4725><s%> where you are northward <S%H6828><s%>, and southward <S%H5045><s%>, and eastward <S%H6924><s%>, and westward <S%H3220><s%>:
For all the land <S%H776><s%> which you see <S%H7200><s%>, to you will I give it <S%H5414><s%>, and to your seed <S%H2233><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> ever <S%H5769><s%>.

And I will make <S%H7760><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>: so that <S%H834><s%> if a man <S%H376><s%> can <S%H3201><s%> number <S%H4487><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, then shall your seed <S%H2233><s%> also be numbered <S%H4487><s%>.
Arise <S%H6965><s%>, walk <S%H1980><s%> through the land <S%H776><s%> in the length <S%H753><s%> of it and in the breadth <S%H7341><s%> of it <S%H5414><s%>; for I will give it unto you.

Then Abram <S%H87><s%> removed his tent <S%H167><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> in the plain <S%H436><s%> of Mamre <S%H4471><s%>, which is in Hebron <S%H2275><s%>, and built <S%H1129><s%> there a altar <S%H4196><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
